sentences: Me näitasime oma tantsu esimest korda.
context: The word 'tantsu' is the partitive case form of the Estonian noun 'tants', which means 'dance'. The partitive case typically indicates an incomplete action or partial object. In this context, 'tantsu' can be translated as 'dance', 'dancing', or 'of dance' depending on the sentence structure. It's used to refer to the act of dancing or a particular dance performance.
